thread.title: Conor McGregor Says He’s Not in ‘Game of Thrones’ Season 7
thread.title_full: Conor McGregor Says He’s Not in ‘Game of Thrones’ Season 7

author: Jonathan Sawyer
title: Conor McGregor Says He’s Not in ‘Game of Thrones’ Season 7
text:
Contrary to multiple reports , UFC icon Conor McGregor will not be in season seven of Game of Thrones .
McGregor disputed the claims during a recent interview on the Good Times Network variety channel (see above), but he did mention that months ago he was visited by unnamed people from HBO after a fight.
“That was everywhere and I’ve never even heard about it!” McGregor said. “I heard about it once after [a fight] … backstage in the dressing room. [UFC brass, including Dana White, were] in front of me and they were saying ‘these [visitors] want you to be in Game of Thrones.’”
He then went on to add: “I’m banged up, my shin’s in a heap, I’ve been kicking his knee’s straight for 25 minutes, my leg’s in bits, and he’s trying to offer me a Game of Thrones role. And I’m saying, ‘Listen, come at me with sh– I want to hear, I’m not trying to be in show business, I’m trying to be in the fight business. Come at me with a real number to fight again. So that was the only time I ever heard the [words] Games of Thrones. And it went everywhere like months later! So I don’t know where that came from. But I’ve never been in contact with nobody from Game of Thrones and now I’m starring in Game of f—ing Thrones!”
So while it doesn’t appear that we’ll see McGregor making his HBO acting debut any time soon, we still might get that much-coveted fight between he and Floyd Mayweather.
